meanings.sent1: She consumed the delicious cake in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: The hungry child consumed his entire plate of food.
meanings.sent3: After a long day, he consumed a hearty meal and felt content.
meanings.sent4: Her love for chocolate consumed her thoughts all day.
meanings.sent5: The flames quickly consumed the dry wood in the fireplace.

meanings.sent1: The wildfire consumed all the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The factory consumed a large amount of electricity each day.
meanings.sent3: The shopping spree consumed all her savings in a matter of hours.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat consumed all the remaining water in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The marathon consumed all his energy, leaving him exhausted.

meanings.definition: To be engrossed or absorbed in (an activity)
meanings.sent1: She consumed the book, unable to put it down.
meanings.sent2: The children consumed their time playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: He consumed his day watching movies on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The artist consumed himself in creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The students consumed the lesson, eager to learn more.

meanings.sent1: The fire consumed the old building in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The flood consumed the crops in the fields.
meanings.sent3: His anger consumed all chances of reconciliation.
meanings.sent4: The virus consumed the data on his computer.
meanings.sent5: The darkness consumed the light, leaving everything in shadow.
